items.title: US government shutdown live: first closure since 2018 begins after funding bill fails
items.standfirst: Competing bills rejected in Senate as Republicans and Democrats accuse each other of partisan politics. Follow the latest news and updates after the US government shut downUS government shuts downTracker: how each US senator votedNational Park staff are among federal workers required to stop working in a government shutdown. But staff feared Trump officials could once again push for leaving America’s parks open when they are unstaffed.Irreversible damage was done at popular parks, including Joshua Tree in California, following a month-long shutdown in Donald Trump’s first term, when his administration demanded parks be kept open while funding was paused and workers were furloughed. Continue reading...

items.title: First closure of US government since 2018 begins after funding bill fails – as it happened
items.standfirst: This live blog is closed. Please follow US government shutdown updates and developments in our new rolling live blog hereUS government shutdown – live updatesThe US government is hurtling towards its first shutdown in six years, with no signs congressional leaders are near agreement on legislation to continue funding beyond the Tuesday night deadline to prevent workers from being furloughed and agencies from shutting their doors.Congress’s Republican majority is pushing legislation to fund the government through 21 November, but Democrats have refused to vote for it unless it includes a series of concessions centered on healthcare. Continue reading...
items.content: This live blog is closed. Please follow US government shutdown updates and developments in our new rolling live blog hereUS government shutdown – live updatesThe US government is hurtling towards its first shutdown in six years, with no signs congressional leaders are near agreement on legislation to continue funding beyond the Tuesday night deadline to prevent workers from being furloughed and agencies from shutting their doors.Congress’s Republican majority is pushing legislation to fund the government through 21 November, but Democrats have refused to vote for it unless it includes a series of concessions centered on healthcare. Continue reading...

items.title: The U.S. Government Just Shut Down: Here's What It Means for the Economy and Stocks
items.standfirst: For the first time since 2019, the U.S. Government is shut down. The shutdown, which started just after midnight on Wednesday, came after lawmakers failed to pass a budget for the government's fiscal year 2026. A shutdown was widely expected after lawmakers from both parties met at the White House…

items.standfirst: The U.S. government shutdown officially began at 12:01a.m. after the Senate failed to reach an agreement, rejecting both a Democratic funding bill and a Republican measure. The shutdown will impact millions of federal employees and could disrupt services.

items.title: US government shuts down after Democrats refuse to back Republican funding plan
items.standfirst: First shutdown in nearly seven years as Republicans accused of ‘risking America’s healthcare’ in spending billUS government shutdown – live updatesThe US government shut down on Wednesday, after congressional Democrats refused to support a Republican plan to extend funding for federal departments unless they won a series of concessions centered on healthcare.The GOP, which controls the Senate and the House of Representatives, repudiated their demands, setting off a legislative scramble that lasted into the hours before funding lapsed at midnight, when the Senate failed to advance both parties’ bills to keep funding going. Continue reading...
items.content: First shutdown in nearly seven years as Republicans accused of ‘risking America’s healthcare’ in spending billUS government shutdown – live updatesThe US government shut down on Wednesday, after congressional Democrats refused to support a Republican plan to extend funding for federal departments unless they won a series of concessions centered on healthcare.The GOP, which controls the Senate and the House of Representatives, repudiated their demands, setting off a legislative scramble that lasted into the hours before funding lapsed at midnight, when the Senate failed to advance both parties’ bills to keep funding going. Continue reading...

items.title: How government shutdown could impact the economy
items.standfirst: For the first time since 2018, an impasse on federal spending shut down the government at midnight. The Congressional Budget Office estimates over 750,000 workers will be furloughed. Caitlin Huey-Burns reports the impact will ripple across the U.S. economy.
items.content: For the first time since 2018, an impasse on federal spending shut down the government at midnight. The Congressional Budget Office estimates over 750,000 workers will be furloughed. Caitlin Huey-Burns reports the impact will ripple across the U.S. economy.

ai_summary: The US government entered a shutdown after Congress failed to pass a funding bill.
Republicans and Democrats disagreed on the bill's provisions, leading to the impasse.
The shutdown is the first since 2018, impacting federal workers and agencies.
National Park staff were concerned about parks remaining open without adequate staffing.
Previous shutdowns caused damage to national parks due to lack of maintenance.

items.title: Death toll from Philippines earthquake rises to 60, official says
Philippines earthquake: dozens dead as rescuers search through wreckage
items.standfirst: Rescuers search for casualties in coastal city of Bogo, where power was knocked out and buildings and roads damagedThe death toll from a magnitude 6.9 earthquake that struck central Philippines has risen to 60, a civil defence official said on Wednesday.“We are receiving additional numbers of reported casualties so this thing is very fluid. We are receiving reports [that] as high as 60 individuals are reported to have perished in this earthquake,” Rafaelito Alejandro, deputy administrator of the government’s civil defence office told reporters in Manila. Continue reading...
items.content: Rescuers search for casualties in coastal city of Bogo, where power was knocked out and buildings and roads damagedThe death toll from a magnitude 6.9 earthquake that struck central Philippines has risen to 60, a civil defence official said on Wednesday.“We are receiving additional numbers of reported casualties so this thing is very fluid. We are receiving reports [that] as high as 60 individuals are reported to have perished in this earthquake,” Rafaelito Alejandro, deputy administrator of the government’s civil defence office told reporters in Manila. Continue reading...

items.title: Over 90 people believed buried under rubble after Indonesia school collapse

items.content: Authorities say six people are still alive under the rubble of the school and in contact with rescue workers.

items.title: Indonesia school collapse: 91 missing and three dead as rescuers search rubble for second day
items.standfirst: Desperate search for more than 90 missing after building collapses while students held prayers at school in SidoarjoParents and rescuers in Indonesia were desperately searching for dozens of teenage boys believed to be trapped, a day after the collapse of an Islamic boarding school which has already left three dead, authorities said.Authorities said 91 people were listed as missing after the Al Khoziny school building collapsed while pupils held late afternoon prayers in a mosque housed on a lower floor of a building whose upper floors were under construction. Continue reading...
items.content: Desperate search for more than 90 missing after building collapses while students held prayers at school in SidoarjoParents and rescuers in Indonesia were desperately searching for dozens of teenage boys believed to be trapped, a day after the collapse of an Islamic boarding school which has already left three dead, authorities said.Authorities said 91 people were listed as missing after the Al Khoziny school building collapsed while pupils held late afternoon prayers in a mosque housed on a lower floor of a building whose upper floors were under construction. Continue reading...

items.title: Urgent search underway for students after deadly school building collapse
items.standfirst:
In southeast Indonesia, a top floor of a building collapsed during construction while
students were gathered for afternoon prayer. Rescuers are now trying to save dozens of students caught beneath the rubble. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez has the story.
items.content:
In southeast Indonesia, a top floor of a building collapsed during construction while
students were gathered for afternoon prayer. Rescuers are now trying to save dozens of students caught beneath the rubble. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez has the story.

items.title: Indonesia school collapse: three dead and over 90 missing as rescue effort continues
items.standfirst: Instability of building in East Java town hampers search but 99 boys and school staff known to have survivedParents were desperately searching for scores of missing teenage boys feared trapped under huge piles of concrete on Tuesday after a building at an Islamic boarding school collapsed in Indonesia.Authorities said 91 people were listed as missing at Al Khoziny school after the collapse as pupils held late-afternoon prayers in a mosque housed on a lower floor of a building whose upper floors were under construction. Continue reading...
items.content: Instability of building in East Java town hampers search but 99 boys and school staff known to have survivedParents were desperately searching for scores of missing teenage boys feared trapped under huge piles of concrete on Tuesday after a building at an Islamic boarding school collapsed in Indonesia.Authorities said 91 people were listed as missing at Al Khoziny school after the collapse as pupils held late-afternoon prayers in a mosque housed on a lower floor of a building whose upper floors were under construction. Continue reading...

ai_summary: An Islamic boarding school building collapsed in Indonesia, trapping students.
Authorities reported three deaths and over 90 people missing after the collapse.
Rescuers are searching through the rubble for survivors.
The building was under construction, with upper floors unfinished.
Parents are desperately searching for their missing teenage children.

items.standfirst: Ek founded Stockholm-based music streaming company nearly two decades ago and will stay on as executive chairSpotify said Tuesday that founder Daniel Ek is stepping down as CEO to become the executive chair.The Stockholm-based streaming giant said Ek will be replaced by two lieutenants who will become co-CEOs: chief product and technology officer Gustav Söderström and chief business officer Alex Norström. The pair, who are also currently co-presidents, will transition into their new jobs on 1 January. Continue reading...
